available.name: available
available.comment:
Returns true if the API is available. The common causes of an API not being avilable are:

  • a permission is missing in the application's manifest.json file
  • the API is defined on a newer version of Chrome then the current runtime

acceptDanger.name: acceptDanger
acceptDanger.comment: Prompt the user to accept a dangerous download. Does not automatically accept dangerous downloads. If the download is accepted, then an chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeDownloads.onChanged event will fire, otherwise nothing will happen. When all the data is fetched into a temporary file and either the download is not dangerous or the danger has been accepted, then the temporary file is renamed to the target filename, the state changes to 'complete', and chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeDownloads.onChanged fires. chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeDownloads.acceptDanger.downloadId: The identifier for the chrome/chrome_ext.DownloadItem. callback: Called when the danger prompt dialog closes.

cancel.name: cancel
cancel.comment: Cancel a download. When callback is run, the download is cancelled, completed, interrupted or doesn't exist anymore. chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeDownloads.cancel.downloadId: The id of the download to cancel. callback: Called when the cancel request is completed.

download.name: download
download.comment: Download a URL. If the URL uses the HTTPS protocol, then the request will include all cookies currently set for its hostname. If both filename and saveAs are specified, then the Save As dialog will be displayed, pre-populated with the specified filename. If the download started successfully, callback will be called with the new chrome/chrome_ext.DownloadItem's downloadId. If there was an error starting the download, then callback will be called with downloadId=undefined and runtime.lastError will contain a descriptive string. The error strings are not guaranteed to remain backwards compatible between releases. Extensions must not parse it. chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeDownloads.download.options: What to download and how. callback: Called with the id of the new chrome/chrome_ext.DownloadItem.

drag.name: drag
drag.comment: Initiate dragging the downloaded file to another application. Call in a javascript ondragstart handler.

erase.name: erase
erase.comment: Erase matching chrome/chrome_ext.DownloadItem from history without deleting the downloaded file. An chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeDownloads.onErased event will fire for each chrome/chrome_ext.DownloadItem that matches query, then callback will be called.

getFileIcon.name: getFileIcon
getFileIcon.comment: Retrieve an icon for the specified download. For new downloads, file icons are available after the chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeDownloads.onCreated event has been received. The image returned by this function while a download is in progress may be different from the image returned after the download is complete. Icon retrieval is done by querying the underlying operating system or toolkit depending on the platform. The icon that is returned will therefore depend on a number of factors including state of the download, platform, registered file types and visual theme. If a file icon cannot be determined, runtime.lastError will contain an error message. chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeDownloads.getFileIcon.downloadId: The identifier for the download. callback: A URL to an image that represents the download.

open.name: open
open.comment: Open the downloaded file now if the chrome/chrome_ext.DownloadItem is complete; otherwise returns an error through runtime.lastError. Requires the "downloads.open" permission in addition to the "downloads" permission. An chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeDownloads.onChanged event will fire when the item is opened for the first time. chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeDownloads.open.downloadId: The identifier for the downloaded file.

pause.name: pause
pause.comment: Pause the download. If the request was successful the download is in a paused state. Otherwise runtime.lastError contains an error message. The request will fail if the download is not active. chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeDownloads.pause.downloadId: The id of the download to pause. callback: Called when the pause request is completed.

removeFile.name: removeFile
removeFile.comment: Remove the downloaded file if it exists and the chrome/chrome_ext.DownloadItem is complete; otherwise return an error through runtime.lastError.

resume.name: resume
resume.comment: Resume a paused download. If the request was successful the download is in progress and unpaused. Otherwise runtime.lastError contains an error message. The request will fail if the download is not active. chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeDownloads.resume.downloadId: The id of the download to resume. callback: Called when the resume request is completed.

search.name: search
search.comment: Find chrome/chrome_ext.DownloadItem. Set query to the empty object to get all chrome/chrome_ext.DownloadItem. To get a specific chrome/chrome_ext.DownloadItem, set only the id field. To page through a large number of items, set orderBy: ['-startTime'], set limit to the number of items per page, and set startedAfter to the startTime of the last item from the last page.

setShelfEnabled.name: setShelfEnabled
setShelfEnabled.comment: Enable or disable the gray shelf at the bottom of every window associated with the current browser profile. The shelf will be disabled as long as at least one extension has disabled it. Enabling the shelf while at least one other extension has disabled it will return an error through runtime.lastError. Requires the "downloads.shelf" permission in addition to the "downloads" permission.

show.name: show
show.comment: Show the downloaded file in its folder in a file manager. chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeDownloads.show.downloadId: The identifier for the downloaded file.

showDefaultFolder.name: showDefaultFolder
showDefaultFolder.comment: Show the default Downloads folder in a file manager.

available.name: available
available.comment:
Returns true if the API is available. The common causes of an API not being avilable are:

  • a permission is missing in the application's manifest.json file
  • the API is defined on a newer version of Chrome then the current runtime

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeDownloads.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeDownloads.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeDownloads.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeDownloads.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeDownloads.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeDownloads.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeDownloads.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.
